It is characterized by its elongated, tubular leaves that can reach several inches in length, adapted to capture moisture from the humid environment. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically clustered at the base of the stem, often in shades of pale yellow or green. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
